1088116589461950464.text: Welcome to the official AMP Twitter account. AMP designs and builds some of the greatest decentralized applications on Ethereum. We focus on providing great UX and ease of use which makes our products amazing to use.

1104531170841243648.text: 10/ Most important of all. Open Source is not always necessary. It may be the biggest thing holding you back. You should never feel obligated to open source your smart-contract or your frontend.

1104530929530404869.text: 9/ If you are going to offer an off-chain thing to be efficient, if possible see if you can also add an on-chain thing so that other dapps can easily integrate

1104530458069684224.text: 8/ Stop using Truffle. It's terrible, everyone knows it.

1104530251269525504.text:
7/ Stop wasting time on testnet. If you can afford to pay for a server, you can afford to test on mainnet. 

Testnet is a complete waste of time.

1104529944695181313.text: 6/ Upgrade software frequently. Stop acting like you are deploying hardware just because the smart-contract never goes away.

1104529674384953345.text: 5/ If your dapp is financial, make sure the contracts are perpetual. Don't build financial dapps that are designed with expiration. Why? No one wants to place a bet on whether ETH will go up 5% by May 2019. Everyone wants to bet on whether ETH will go up in the future. No expiry.

1104528917166215173.text: 4/ Settle financial agreements in a fiat stablecoin, pick USDC, Tether, or TrueUSD. Whatever you want, just as long as a lot of people have it and it's liquid.

1104528661921890308.text: 3/ Make sure the dapp will bring new users in, don't make a dapp that only will get users from people that have been in crypto for years.

1104528213630439425.text: 2/ Only work with synthetic assets, where the "real" asset is located outside of the blockchain. Why? MakerDAO get's hacked, Dai is done. USDC gets hacked, Centre refunds everyone.
